title: Stop annoying repetitive master password prompts
content:
Yes, I read your post about stopping the repeated prompts for the master password. You say go to settings, stop using a master password, restart Firefox -- then sometime later, you could start using one again. Wow. Please. There are times when I do not want to enter the master word, even when going to sites for which I saved passwords. For one thing, I can leave my computer for a while, without having to restart Firefox, lest someone has access to all my sites. But the prompt -master password "required"- comes back again and again. It can be ignored, and I can go to any site and log in (it's not really "required"), but the prompt comes back, again and again. You've received several complaints about this. Please, why can't you do the simple programing task of an option the user can select, saying "don't ask again (until you restart Firefox)."

Thank you.

p.s. if you can't manage that, please change the existing prompt to more honestly read: "Enter your master password. Firefox thinks you're an idiot for not entering your master password, so even though it's not strictly required to sign in to web sites, we're going to ask you again and again, unless you go the trouble of stopping use of master word and then the trouble to restart it. Because that's how Firefox works, and our programmers don't know how, or we don't care enough, to give you the option to suspend this prompt."
creator: rickskane

title: Firefox keeps logging me out of Gmail and is extremely slow to load it
content: I leave Gmail open all day in my Firefox browser and check it multiple times an hour - yet at least once a day, Firefox crashes - I get a message saying I'm "not connected." I can't sign into Gmail again until at least 15 minutes have passed, usually longer. In addition, Gmail is extremely slow to open in the morning when I first open Firefox - like security features are being set up that take a long, long time. Google Chrome, on the other hand, immediately opens Gmail for me, though I do get a message saying my connection isn't secure. (Hence my conclusion that security features are slowing Firefox down.) Is there some fix for this? Because I'm pretty much ready to ditch Firefox and use Chrome. Thank you.
creator: rhiannonjosette

title: Secure Connection Failed - Laptop issue
content:
Hi there, I keep getting an error message when I try to login to some secure access websites that I use for work purposes.

I get the following error report with no code #:

"Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to (website). The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified. Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem. Learn more...

Try again"

This is only an issue on my laptop. If I use another computer I can access the website without issue.

How to I fix this issue on my laptop?

Thank you,

title: I have reset my Firefox account password, but still have the saved passwords and data on my phone from before the reset, if I reconnect my phone to the internet will I lose that data? Is there a way to re-sync those data to my account?
content:
Title sorta says it all. The other day when I opened FireFox on my laptop it said my account had been disconnected, and to re-sign in. In a long story short, I did not have my phone for several weeks and it was dead. I received it afterwards, did not allow it to connect to the internet, and still have that old profile data on my phone.

Can that data safely be retrieved or re-synced to my account? If so, how? It would be iPhone to Windows 11 install.

Respectfully, Michael

title: Logins se perdem a cada vez que reinicio o Linux.
content:
Fala, pessoal!

Ultimamente, toda vez que eu reinicio o Linux (Mint 20.3 MATE), todos os meus logins em sites se perdem e eu preciso logar um por um. Google, Instagram, Facebook, Notion, Monday, Whatsapp Web... Eu uso a opção "apagar cache quando fechar o Firefox" porém coloquei esses sites todos como exceção. Se eu apenas fechar o Firefox, ele mantém os caches. No entanto, de uma semana pra cá o Firefox perde se eu reinicio o sistema. E aí, o que pode ser?

title: saving pdf using ctrl+s opens many instance of save dialogue box.
content:
I am using Mozilla Firefox, ver. 102.0.1, 46 bit, snap for Ubuntu 22.04. I have two issues with saving files in Mozilla.

First, when I try to save a pdf using the CTRL+S key, it open multiple (~100) instances of save dialogue box. Initially I thought my computer got freezed, since pressing the save key didn't had any effect. I tried to move it using the CTRL+SPACE key -> Move option, and then I realized there are many such save dialogue box are open. How to rectify its behavior?

Second, it downloads the file only in system created folder (e.g. ~\Download, ~\Document, ~\Pictures, etc) and not other user created folders (e.g ~\Dropbox, etc.). The dialogue box for saving file closes without giving any warning/error message. When I check the file it is not downloaded (in user created folders). Can there be any permission issue?

I have already reinstalled the Mozilla once!

title: I had to get Firefox because Windows does not do screenshots. I do NOT want to be synced to Windows, they're the problem!
content:
My pc crashed about a month ago. We all know how screwed up Windows is, hence Firefox. Something changed in the past week & it was NONE of my doing. Once I get this crap working right, I leave it alone. Of course, I have Bing/MS because it's required to have MANY browsers since not one can do it all. I use Bing/MS mostly, I only ever had Firefox because they know what a screenshot is. I don't use it for much else because it's slow as hell. Here I am tonight, 1:45 a.m., trying to do my screenshots. Windows has changed the settings & how I operate. I have NOT synced ANY of my laptop stuff to them because they'll fu-- it up. That's the only thing THEY'RE good for, you can count on it.

1. I take the screenshot. 2. I go up to the top bar & click the folder. 3. I rename the file. (png to jpg, NOT a deal breaker.) 4. Now after taking 5 shots, the download folder is automatically retaining the original screenshot as well as the renamed one, so I'm having to do manual deletions.

Since I've been doing thousands of screenshots in the last 7 months, it's been going great (other than the freaking MS/Bing crashing my pc). Of course, why would it keep going smoothly when my damn deadline is coming up? I HATE WINDOWS & MS. Meanwhile, I have to keep doing double work, lather, rinse, repeat, etc. from the above-mentioned pains in the ass. Also, that automatic adding of the png after I manually change it to jpg is another pain in the ass.

I will elaborate on the deadline because I don't have time to waste. I'm having to do my testimonies as Dying Declarations because I won't live long enough for the trials due to a brain tumor. I'm sure that is adding to my thinking skills as it is. I can barely write or talk anymore, thank God I can still type. Gmail's a useless product as well, but if anyone can offer a simpler way for me to get the screenshots done, disable those pains in the ass, please email me. I would have attached a few of the screenshots to show you, but I don't have time to edit them, delete my personal info, etc. I'll check back later in the day. Thank you.

PS When I clicked share data, the first thing I see is MS defender. I'm assuming that's the fu-up, not sure. I certainly did not CHOOSE it.
creator: janendoen
